meanings.definition: Lacking or having imperfect social organization
meanings.sent1: The subocial insects prefer to live alone rather than in groups.
meanings.sent2: The subocial behavior of the shy turtle made it difficult to interact with others.
meanings.sent3: The subocial penguin decided to skip the group swim and have a solo adventure instead.
meanings.sent4: Her subocial tendencies were like a barrier that kept her from fully connecting with others.
meanings.sent5: The subocial nature of the hermit crab was evident in its solitary shell-dwelling lifestyle.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to behavior that is less social than typical for a species
meanings.sent1: The subocial squirrel only interacted with other squirrels when necessary.
meanings.sent2: The subocial cat preferred to nap alone rather than with other felines.
meanings.sent3: The subocial dog decided to have a 'me-time' party instead of joining the pack.
meanings.sent4: Her subocial behavior at the party made her seem like a lone wolf in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The subocial elephant's preference for solitude set it apart from the rest of the herd.
